The object of the study: ( a) the azo–benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxamide (BTA) star with benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxamide core and three azobenzene arms. Each arm carries the N, N-dimethylamino group. Here, the optimized geometry is shown [ 14]. A snapshot of the columnar aggregate with N = 20 from MD trajectory [ 29] is illustrated in panel ( b). The azobenzene star studied experimentally by Lee et al. [ 17] is depicted in panel ( c). The conformation of this star is the same as in the crystalline structure, shown in panel ( d).
